response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "At 18, young age is associated with higher impulsivity and recidivism risk."],
    ["Gender", "high", "Males statistically show higher rates of recidivism."],
    ["Criminal History", "high", "Having an arrest and conviction history significantly increases risk."],
    ["Education", "low", "Being enrolled in a 4-year college is a protective factor that can reduce recidivism."],
    ["Employment", "medium", "Holding only one job in the past year suggests limited employment stability."],
    ["Living Situation", "medium", "Living alone can indicate less social support, contributing moderately to risk."],
    ["Substance Use", "low", "No drug use in the past four years lowers recidivism risk."],
    ["Mental Health", "low", "Not experiencing depression in the past month is a protective factor."],
    ["Household Background", "medium", "Living in a household of 4 with a biological mother provides moderate familial structure."],
    ["Religious Belief", "low", "Attributing events to God can be a coping mechanism and is seen as protective."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: At 18, young age is associated with higher impulsivity and recidivism risk.
Males statistically show higher rates of recidivism.
Having an arrest and conviction history significantly increases risk.
Being enrolled in a 4-year college is a protective factor that can reduce recidivism.
Holding only one job in the past year suggests limited employment stability.
Living alone can indicate less social support, contributing moderately to risk.
No drug use in the past four years lowers recidivism risk.
Not experiencing depression in the past month is a protective factor.
Living in a household of 4 with a biological mother provides moderate familial structure.
Attributing events to God can be a coping mechanism and is seen as protective.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 0 inches and weighs 160 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 4-year college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
